titles.title: Recognizing the contributions of the Christmas tree industry to the United States economy.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Horticulture and Organic Agriculture.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Peterson (MN) moved to suspend the rules and pass the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 15.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

bill.summary: 12/17/2007--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Recognizes the important contributions to the U.S. economy of the live-cut Christmas tree industry, Christmas tree growers, and persons employed in the live-cut Christmas tree industry.
